result.execSummary:
The defendant Valentino Donronnel Varese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Operating Commercial Motor Vehicle without a License - WI Resident, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Pay all costs and surcharges by 3/23/2016.  Penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Huber privileges for work.  No electronic monitoring.  Credit for one (1) day.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.  Huber privileges for work.  No electronic monitoring.
*10/22/2015  Defendant may serve sentence of this case in Dane County, if he is accepted.

charges.descr: Operating Commercial Motor Vehicle without a License - WI Resident

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Valentino Donronnel Varese

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Mailed Bail Refund Notice to Surety.
From Defendant; requesting to serve sentence in Dane County. Received and filed 10/14/15.
Allowing defendant to serve sentence in Dane County. Signed and filed.

Defendant Valentino Donronnel Varese in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day served; Huber privileges for work; NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING. 

AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to COUNT 1; Huber privileges for work; NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 03-23-2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Defendant Valentino Donronnel Varese in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State.  Defense argued the correctness of the defendant's prior record.  Case adjourned to verify defendant's prior record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Valentino Donronnel Varese in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

PROTASIEWICZ, BRANCH 24 WILL NOT BE IN SESSION ON MAY 21, 2015.  CASE RESCHEDULED TO JUNE 15, 2015 AT 1:30 PM.  PLEASE NOTIFY YOUR CLIENT OF THE CHANGE.  IF THIS DATE IS INCONVENIENT, PLEASE CONTACT THE CLERK AT 414-278-4775 TO RESCHEDULE.

Defendant Valentino Donronnel Varese in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered the $300.00 cash bail to be returned to the remitter.

Defendant Valentino Donronnel Varese in court.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 24  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/30/15 @ 1:30 pm
